com.software.reuze

Class aa_a_SimpleProblemSolving

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.aa_a_Agent
      • com.software.reuze.aa_a_SimpleProblemSolving
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    aa_i_Agent, aa_i_EnvironmentObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    aa_SimpleProblemSolvingMap

    public abstract class aa_a_SimpleProblemSolving
extends aa_a_Agent
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): Figure 3.1, page 67.

     function SIMPLE-PROBLEM-SOLVING-AGENT(percept) returns an action
   persistent: seq, an action sequence, initially empty
               state, some description of the current world state
               goal, a goal, initially null
               problem, a problem formulation
           
   state <- UPDATE-STATE(state, percept)
   if seq is empty then
     goal    <- FORMULATE-GOAL(state)
     problem <- FORMULATE-PROBLEM(state, goal)
     seq     <- SEARCH(problem)
     if seq = failure then return a null action
   action <- FIRST(seq)
   seq <- REST(seq)
   return action
    Figure 3.1 A simple problem-solving agent. It first formulates a goal and a problem, searches for a sequence of actions that would solve the problem, and then executes the actions one at a time. When this is complete, it formulates another goal and starts over.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Mike Stampone

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      aa_a_SimpleProblemSolving()
      Constructs a simple problem solving agent which will formulate goals indefinitely.
      aa_a_SimpleProblemSolving(int maxGoalsToFormulate)
      Constructs a simple problem solving agent which will formulate, at maximum, the specified number of goals.
